title: Best German Christmas markets for a magical festive break in 2019
text:

There's nothing quite like Christmas markets to get into the festive spirit in the lead-up to Christmas itself.

Then of course they can make for a fun way to use up some annual leave and make a city break out of it.

Of course if you're looking to explore some of Europe's best Christmas markets , there's no denying that Germany could be just the destination.

It famously leads the charge for impressive Christmas market offerings, with bustling marketplaces filled with stalls offering everything from mouthwatering foodie treats to trinkets and decorations, as well as heaps of gift opportunities.

There are so many markets on offer so to give you a helping hand we've picked out some of the best German Christmas markets that need to be on your radar.

Check out our top picks below..

(On a budget? You may also want to check out our guide to finding Christmas market deals ).

1. Berlin

(Image: Getty Images Europe)

Berlin offers up over 70 Christmas markets so you'll be spoiled for choice whether you're looking for somewhere with a bit of hustle and bustle, after a traditional market experience or want to be dazzled by the festive decorations.

You can find out more about the various markets and what they offer on the Visit Berlin website , but highlights include the iconic market on Alexanderplatz as well as the oldest of the markets, the Gendarmenmarkt Christmas market. (The dates vary depending on your chosen market).

Never been to the city before? Check out our Berlin city guide with top tips on everything from the best attractions to the top restaurants.

2. Cologne

(Image: The Image Bank)

Cologne has everything you could want for a picture-perfect Christmas market break.

The market takes place by the breathtaking Cologne Cathedral and boasts hundreds of traditional wooden stalls where vendors sell everything from eye-catching gingerbread creations and mulled wine to handmade decorations and plenty of trinkets ideal for Christmas gifts.

Make sure to leave time to wander through the picturesque Old Town where charming restaurants and boutiques also await.

The Cologne market will run from the 25th November to the 24th December 2019.

3. Munich

(Image: Look)

Munich's traditional Christmas Market takes over the Marienplatz in the lead up to Christmas, boasting everything from a huge Christmas tree to stalls adorned in twinkling lights for a pretty magical effect.

The stands themselves serve up some mouthwatering local delicacies and festive treats and often tend to be a hit with foodies, while the arts and crafts stalls are ideal for finding handmade gifts for your loved-ones.

The Munich market will run from the 27th November to 24th December 2019.

4. Stuttgart

(Image: Getty Images)

You'll feel like you've stepped directly into the scene of a festive postcard thanks to the dazzling light displays and traditional decorations that make up this picturesque market.

The tents themselves offer up heaps of gift buying opportunities from stalls filled with teddy bears and toys to handmade crafts and clothes.

Expect plenty of fun for kids too including a miniature railway and ice rink.

The Stuttgart market will run from the 27th November to the 23rd December 2019.

5. Nuremberg

(Image: Getty Images)

Nuremberg is a real foodie's delight thanks to the stalls serving up mulled wine, rum punch, bratwurst, gingerbread and roasted nuts, filling up the air with some seriously enticing aromas.

If you can tear yourself away from the food stalls, you'll find plenty more yuletide joys including arts and crafts stalls, traditional decorations, and plenty of fun and games to be had for the whole family.

The Nuremberg market will run from the 28th November to the 23rd December 2019.

6. Dresden

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

History fans may want to check out Dresden's Christmas market, the oldest in Germany which dates back to the 15th century.

Although Dresden has a number of markets, the Striezelmarkt tends to be the biggest and most popular.

Expect plenty of craft stalls, as well as foodie spots offering up some mouthwatering local delicacies such as Stollen Cake.

The Dresden market will run from the 27th November to the 24th December 2019.

7. Frankfurt

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

Located amidst the picturesque Römerberg and St Paul's Square, Frankfurt's market offers a whimsical feel thanks to the stunning architecture surrounding the traditional stalls, and of course the huge Christmas tree that towers tall above the hustle and bustle.

Think foodie stalls, arts and crafts offerings, and even a carousel that's sure to be a hit with kids.

The Frankfurt market will run from the 25th November to the 22nd December 2019.

8. Leipzig

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

This market traditionally takes place during the Advent season and makes for quite a picturesque festive day out.

Think heaps of colourful decorations, dazzling Christmas trees adorned in twinkling lights and picturesque stalls serving local delicacies, mulled wine and heaps of opportunities for finding the perfect Christmas gifts for your loved ones.

The Leipzig market will run from the 26th November to the 23rd December 2019.

9. Hamburg

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

The Weihnachtsmarkt held in front of the Town Hall tends to be the main one where you'll find the hustle and bustle - the huge Christmas tree there makes it easy to find.

At night it's particularly spectacular thanks to the hundreds of twinkling lights which adorn the stalls, trees and surrounding buildings.

Add in the stalls ranging from food offerings to clothes and handmade decorations, and it's easy to while a few hours here.

The Weihnachtsmarkt will run from the 25th November to the 23rd December 2019.

10. Heidelberg

(Image: Getty Images/EyeEm)

Heidelberg's Old Town is where you'll want to head for the festive season.

Here you'll find a picturesque market with heaps of stalls, as well as eye-catching decorations, charming restaurants and surrounding architecture that looks like something out of a storybook.

The Heidelberg Christmas market will run from the 25th November to the 22nd December 2019.
description: Germany's best Christmas markets offer up extra festive cheer with hundreds of stalls offering foodie treats, souvenirs and a generally magical atmosphere
